column4: Im a linux noob. Id like to update gaim from 1.4.0 to 1.5.0. I downloaded the source, unpackaged it, ran ./configure, make, make install, and then re-clicked on my bottom panal but when i go to Help > About, it still says 1.4.0. What did I do wrong?
you are aware that gaim 1.5.0 is already in ubuntu breezy ?
Im using horay
its gonna be released in about a week... atleast using the official debs you get updates
the way you're doing it now, you've cut yourself off from ubuntu support and upgrades
I used synaptic and noticed that it said I already had 1.5.0 installed, but Help > About in gaim said otherwise. why is that?
I have 1.5 installed in breezy and it works
hepl says 1.5 correctly, you may have compiled gaim, but it seems you have not installed it correctly
is the process to ./configure, make, make install?
yes, but: sudo make install
Oo! would that cause the issues im having?
typically, yes
okay thank you.
you can upgrade right now if you like
Shoudldnt i wait for the official release the 13th?
I think if you are comfortable compiling your own applications, you should be fine
comfortable? :) I feel like Im going to be sick when I do it. heh We`ll see :)
gnomemeeting
hmm..does that allow someone to connect via a webaddy and open up something like Win Media player (most users will be on windowz)
its comparable to netmeeting I believe
ok thanks.
